content: From USA Today: "Fed to buy $300 Billion in long term Treasury Bonds" From the rest of America: "A bankrupt government using money it doesn’t have to buy bonds nobody wants!" "The solution to our economic woes is for the government to give money to itself!" "Let’s ruin our economy for a couple of weeks of modest gains in the Stock Market!" "Fed to run printing presses 24/7/365 to buy $300 Billion in long-term Treasury bonds." "US tax dollars continue to prop up failed policies and preserve the Status Quo." "The Stock Market rose on today’s news, everything must be swell." "Someone has to buy them (or else…)" "Aren't these the same financial “leaders” who got us into this mess?" "The dollar is like anything else, when you oversupply it, you decrease its value." "Printing money to buy our own debt, what a brilliant scheme!" "Is Bernanke getting his fiscal policy from Zimbabwe?" "Wheelbarrow sales to skyrocket soon…" "Keep the presses running.....what, we’re out of ink?" "Is this a way of letting China off the hook before the dollar becomes worthless?" "Don’t worry, most Americans don’t have the slightest clue of what’s going on!" "It’s like printing your own money to make a loan to yourself!" "My head hurts." "Is this legal?"
reply: From USA Today: "Fed to buy $300 Billion in long term Treasury Bonds" From the rest of America: "A bankrupt government using money it doesn’t have to buy bonds nobody wants!" "The solution to our economic woes is for the government to give money to itself!" "Let’s ruin our economy for a couple of weeks of modest gains in the Stock Market!" "Fed to run printing presses 24/7/365 to buy $300 Billion in long-term Treasury bonds." "US tax dollars continue to prop up failed policies and preserve the Status Quo." "The Stock Market rose on today’s news, everything must be swell." "Someone has to buy them (or else…)" "Aren't these the same financial “leaders” who got us into this mess?" "The dollar is like anything else, when you oversupply it, you decrease its value." "Printing money to buy our own debt, what a brilliant scheme!" "Is Bernanke getting his fiscal policy from Zimbabwe?" "Wheelbarrow sales to skyrocket soon…" "Keep the presses running.....what, we’re out of ink?" "Is this a way of letting China off the hook before the dollar becomes worthless?" "Don’t worry, most Americans don’t have the slightest clue of what’s going on!" "It’s like printing your own money to make a loan to yourself!" "My head hurts." "Is this legal?"
title: Today's Headlines from the Heartland

content: Our market honchos are saying sell,sell, sell. Take advantage of the up market. In a short while there be some choice pickings for cash holders. As somebody remarked about the 'glorious' advance of Sickles' Corps to the Peachfield at Gettysburg, "They'll be back." The 'fleecing of the suckah' continues.
reply: Our market honchos are saying sell,sell, sell. Take advantage of the up market. In a short while there be some choice pickings for cash holders. As somebody remarked about the 'glorious' advance of Sickles' Corps to the Peachfield at Gettysburg, "They'll be back." The 'fleecing of the suckah' continues.
title: Today's Headlines from the Heartland

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: Our market honchos are saying sell,sell, sell. Take advantage of the up market. The Dow at 7,400 is "up"? I guess it could be worse. It could be at 6,400. Or 5,400. Or..... Never mind. I'm heading for the pub for a few pints of Red Hook ESB. Or maybe four. Or five. Or.... Never mind.
quote: Originally posted by popsiq: Our market honchos are saying sell,sell, sell. Take advantage of the up market.
reply: The Dow at 7,400 is "up"? I guess it could be worse. It could be at 6,400. Or 5,400. Or..... Never mind. I'm heading for the pub for a few pints of Red Hook ESB. Or maybe four. Or five. Or.... Never mind.
title: Today's Headlines from the Heartland

content: The Red Hook was a little flat for my taste. Had to settle for Bass Ale. Alas, we all have to make sacrifices.
reply: The Red Hook was a little flat for my taste. Had to settle for Bass Ale. Alas, we all have to make sacrifices.
